website_summaries.verdict: Mesh pads give this drum set an authentic acoustic feel. It's a good choice for beginners, for practice, or for building your skills.
pros: Comes with 60 play-along tracks, sequencer, metronome, recorder, and auxiliary input
Patented mesh drum heads provide quiet, realistic feel
Includes 8" dual-zone snare pad and (3) 8" tom pads
Also features 8" kickdrum and 10" ride cymbal, hi-hat cymbal, and crash  cymbal with choke
cons: The hi-hat cymbal is not very responsive, and other features are relatively quiet when used with headphones

website_summaries.verdict: An electronic drum set with a mid-range price. An excellent workhorse for adult and student drummers alike.
pros: An electronic instrument with an acoustic sound
cons: Has been known to occasionally miss hits due to drum pad sensitivity issues

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner e-kit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to my existing e-kit (a different Alesis kit), as I like more 'voices' than a standard 5-piece e-kit setup can provide. If you're a beginner drummer, or new to e-kits, this one will do the trick. While the sounds available in the 'brain' are not as high quality as you would find in the higher-end e-kits, they still give you a decent sound library to play with, and you can adjust them a bit. The training features are also good, even for more experienced drummers.
customer_reviews.author: MacCanine

customer_reviews.title: Are you for real? Just awesome sauce!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Feels nice. Module sounds are pretty good. I use this with my Logic Pro X to record live and lay clean drum tracks for recordings. You can use the drum sounds in Logic Pro X which sound very real and nice or you can use ezdrummer 2 which is my favorite and have an endless array of kits and sounds to play. Best thing to come along for a home studio in a long time. Hook the band to a PA and you can practice at sound levels that won’t anger your neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: boirokk

customer_reviews.title: Love this set
customer_reviews.text: I'm a keyboardist, not a drummer, but a drummer friend of mine was in the studio and helped set the thing up as a drummer would want it. Highly adjustable, great learning tool, some really good internal sound generators, lots of features. The mesh heads are what makes this set infinitely more usable in the studio than say an Octapad. Only thing I wish for would be the availability of an additional cymbal and mount....at a reasonable price. I found the mfg's add on unit, but the cost is almost $200 ....for one cymbal and short mount!!! The whole set is only $350. Dumb Alesis....just dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Kick drum tower unresponsive half the time
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the top half of this set. However the kick drum is terrible. Its way too quiet compared to all the other drums. When I press the kick drum button on the module, its loud, but no matter how hard i stomp the pedal, its very faint. Thats when it responds at all. every 3 or so kicks it misses beats. Ive played with the settings and still no luck. Its awful.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan g.

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to 1000 dollar kits
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set for 350 bucks. Definitely recommend the nitro mesh instead of rubber, it feels much more realistic. This kit is as good as my buddy's 1100 dollar yamahas, except for the amount of sounds on the drum module which CAN be swapped for something like the alesis forge module
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Broke right away.  Filled out support form at alesis.com.  Alesis ignores request.
customer_reviews.text: One of the cymbals broke right away. Filled out support form at alesis.com. Got nothing but one automated email acknowledging my request and one email asking me to fill out a survey about how well they did in resolving my issue. Two weeks later, got a reply suggesting I make sure that I have the cymbal plugged in and closing the case. Do not buy Alesis. It is junk and their support is non existent.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: POS. Snare shredding less than one week! Boooo!
customer_reviews.text: POS! The snare already coming apart after less than one week! Returning and letting others know this is no where near a reasonably decent item. Such a shame, disappointment, and waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevbo

customer_reviews.title: Cheep... i would not buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to start with I'm a beginner at drums. I read the reviews and watched some videos on this set. I thought it would be good. It has lots of plastic parts (expected at this price point). It was easy to assemble and the directions were easy to follow. I only got to play my set about 15 times. The headphone jack did not work well. If my phone was within 15 feet of the set while it was on all the sound coming from the set was distorted. Its hard to see from the photos but the base of the snare pad broke (almost in half).
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great First Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is THE kit to buy if you’re exploring playing drums. I always wanted to and at this price point I figured what the heck. This isn’t all the bells and whistles but merely a basic entry level kit. You’ll quickly figure out whether you want to continue at which point you can upgrade. The kit is good quality overall, the mesh heads especially. As you advance you’ll fall out of love with the cymbals and kick pedal/bass drum. I strongly recommend for someone looking to pick up a new hobby without completely breaking the bank
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Y

customer_reviews.title: The sound is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This sound from the drumset is abymsal. Despite trying multiple different headphones, the sounds from the drumset at max volume are quiter than the sound of the sticks hitting the pads themselves. Completely demotivating to play.
customer_reviews.author: theseus schulze

customer_reviews.title: High hat control pedal arrived broken - Unable to have the issue resolved.
customer_reviews.text: As the headline states, I received the drum kit and although everything else works, the high hat control pedal arrived broken and I haven't been able to have it replaced. Amazon told me to reach out to the manufacturer which I did. It has now been 2 weeks and the only response I have received was a vague response from Alesis (a representative named "Rich Muggle") on how to reset the control. I haven't received a single response from anyone else at Alesis after the unhelpful email on troubleshooting the pedal. I just wanted a full drum kit that works!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Ok,  so I got one of the lemons.
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that the reviews either loved the drums or NOT. I've tried for over a week to get these useless drums to work. if I raise all individual pads to 32. raise the module volume all the way to the left. and my amp to 10. I can barely hear the drum sounds. absolutely no kick, ride and hi hat. four hundred for practice pads. all electronics are crap. Four mp3 players, two dvd players, and a drum kit. no more. that was my last order.
customer_reviews.author: Burnt toast

customer_reviews.title: So far, I'm surprisingly  and overwhelmingly satisfied with this drum set.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Rolland TK4, with $150 peddles, which I paid about $1200 about 9 years ago(it's the same price today with a new computer) They were stored else where, and with the Pandemic I needed something to keep me busy. This kit being so cheap, I hesitated on the quality, but for a beginner like me it's just perfect, I didn't need to spend $1000 on a Rolland. The only thing I wish for a larger Snare drum, but again for the price, this is a perfect drum set for a beginner, and anyone who can't afford an expensive brand. We'll see how long this thing will last, I'll defiantly come back to review this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz Shopper 223

customer_reviews.title: My husband Loves
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased for an early birthday present for himself. He loves this drum set and I do as well. The neighbors are no longer complaining and they are very quiet. Other than the loud thumping from the drumsticks the sound is almost not noticeable. He loves the drums and uses them to help with stress and as a fun hobby. It also has an attachment for a cellphone to plug into for music selection which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lovz 2 Shop

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and for Rock Band
customer_reviews.text: The Alesis Nitro Mesh was really easy to put together and the brain is pretty user-friendly. It did take quite a while to get the drum pads and cymbals situated. The ride and crash symbols can't be switched around because of the cord length. The snare is also the same size as the toms, so lots of rim hits. The midi adapter was easy to hook up to it and works with Rock Band. I don't feel that Alesis included enough cord keepers though.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rahn

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely pain to put together
customer_reviews.text: If you're am amateur drummer with little or no prior experience then you need to know that the instructions are absolutely abysmal. If it weren't for my prior knowledge of putting stuff together as well as my limited knowledge of drumsets, this would've been an absolute waste of time. Other than that, it's got lots of functions. Sounds pretty good and is easy to play around with. One gripe I have is that you either need 1/4" headphones or an adapter because your little ipod headphones ain't gonna cut it. Even then, it's only mono so expect to only hear in one ear phone while playing. Kinda annoying to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 12th birthday. It works wonderfully without the loudness, and headaches, that an analog system makes. He is playing clone hero with this (midi key 2 key) translating the hits, and we (the whole family) couldn't be happier with the system. Good response, good sounds, overall great deal for a beginner or someone wanting to interact digitally with a "rock band" style game . Plenty of software out there to teach the basics and beyond with a midi interface system. Read up and have the computer ready for it when it comes. We took about 14 hours downloading and getting the pc functional floor what we wanted, this being our first electronic kit/ interface. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James Antikythera

customer_reviews.title: Great drum kit
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this kit for two months. I'm a beginner drummer, but an experienced musician. I have absolutely loved learning on this kit. I've also had professional drummers over to my house to play it - its the real deal. If you are thinking about buying an electronic drum kit, my advice is "do it!"
customer_reviews.author: C. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner drum set, particularly if space is an issue. I'm just starting out and find this a great set, particularly the metronome and built-in lessons, timing practice etc. I do notice a difference from when I'm at my weekly lesson on an accoustic full-set - as you would expect - but the Nitro Mesh Kit is perfect for practice. Highly recommended for those on the beginning of their drum journey. Have fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great set for learning drums
customer_reviews.text: Great starter set. Easy to assemble, sounds great. Everything works perfect. Kids are now following YouTube videos on how to play and learning very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great set, no throne included
customer_reviews.text: I am a self-taught drummer of 15 years and I’ve had my fair share of drums I’ve played on, and so far, this does the job perfectly. The only I wish it came with was the full setup (the additional crash cymbal and throne). The hi-hat had to be adjusted bcuz the default volume was louder than all other cymbals. Other than that, I connected my phone, connected some headphones, and jammed away to some tunes. The next thing I need to invest in is a speaker. It’s not needed, but fun to have when letting other ppl listen to the kit.
customer_reviews.author: jsiL

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: What do you know? Electronics seem to be working, but the headphone jack is apparently toast already. If you can't hear the drums, what's the point of having this system? Waste of money. Cheap crap- should have known.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Set at an Amazing Price
customer_reviews.text: Truly a great set at this price point. I’ve been playing for a long time and just wanted an affordable set for my home studio and the kiddos to lean on. I’m really impressed by the quality, look, controller, and mesh pads. I’m also impressed by the quality of the foot pedals. The only thing that’s a little tough with this set is the 8 inch pad size—it’s small and hard not to hit the rim. But again, at this price point I have no major complaints. If that’s a problem, I recommend spending more :)
customer_reviews.author: Straderade

customer_reviews.title: Decent Beginners Set - Sans The Lessons
customer_reviews.text: This is a good beginners set, for me at least. I am giving 3 stars because I could not get the advertised lessons. If you are buying this set you are probably not an experienced drummer. You need lessons! Their web site repeatedly rejected by registration attempts saying invalid serial number. I took a photo of the serial, emailed their support but they did not reply. Instead I purchased lessons by Drumeo. I'm sure Drumeo is much better anyway. I feel Alesis should refund me for the $$$ I had to spend on alternative lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Vilhjálmur

customer_reviews.title: How does a drummer practice in Quarantine????
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a BD present for our son who is under a stay at home order in his apartment away from his drum kit. This is a lifesaver!!!!! Easy to setup, mesh heads mean when he's headphones are on he's not driving his roommates crazy and it gives him a musical outlet until he can get to his kit!!! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Tink

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive to add on
customer_reviews.text: Decent beginner kit. However, if you want to expand to another cymbal prepare yourself for a ridiculous cost add... $349 for the kit and $179 for an add-on cymbal...aka 51% of the cost of the entire kit for one cymbal????? What a load of malarkey.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher O.

customer_reviews.title: I think it's great
customer_reviews.text: I have never played drums before, and bought this at 66 years old. I'm having lots of fun , wearing youtube out. A little tedious putting it all together, but fairly sturdy and compact when complete. I think the drums sounds are fine, but not spectacular. Not being a real drummer, I have nothing to compare the playability to, but for a beginner I believe this is a really good place to get started. Playability seems fine, and the drum heads feel good. All in all, a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drum kit
customer_reviews.text: I have played for years and wanted to get a digital set for my daughter so that she could play without waking up her brothers. It is wonderful. I love going down and playing on it to. Quality is amazing. I love the feel of the mesh heads, so reactive and awesome to play. Should have bought this years ago and I’m sure my mom wishes this was around 25 years ago when I got my first drum set. The headphones are a families beat friend.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmer32

customer_reviews.title: Worth what you paid
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I brought for a gift to my brother. and al his mates are to happy with this. He is doing well using it for his rock band. Is to easy to setup. The unit is compatible with lot of software like EZdrummer, Studio Drummer, FL Studio and others. My brother said that is easy to create different profiles for each track that you want to play with your band. I just post this in base how they told me..Worth every cent that you paid for that, and they don't see a different for others models that cost more.
customer_reviews.author: Alien P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing set up to the money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to figure out, easy to put together and customize where you wanna put everything. Only complaint, is being a lefty the hi hat chord was too short to run the way I wanted everything. One quick drive to Sam Ash, got an extension for that size chord and done. Sounds great. I finally get to play again being I now live in an apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality kit if you have the right headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this drumkit.. such good value, use some audio technica headphones on kit#25 and it sounds perfect. The toms sound too high out of the box so I changed the preset to the next sounds (ex. 'Tom 1 is now tom 2, tom 2= tom 3, tom 3= deep tom 4) and I love the sound. Perfect to jam on for a long time. I've played rolands with so many functions and not worth the price unless you're beyond advanced, but you wouldnt be reading this if you were! Love this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Easy to play
customer_reviews.text: This is very good little kit. It takes some time setting up. But, once you have everything attached and roughly where you want it to be, fine tuning is pretty simple. It has a lot of options. There almost 400 different sounds you can apply to any one of the striking surfaces. It is not difficult to play, even for someone with zero experience (me. This was a Birthday present for my SO, who knows how to play.) you do not have to try hard to achieve the sound or tone of your strike. The surfaces are reactive, there is no lag. One can tap around and almost make a beat. Very much worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: gkphillips

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent set!
customer_reviews.text: This trumpet is great. My 14-year-old who plays other instruments wanted to branch out into drumming, and this was an ideal set. He can plug-in headphones, speakers and amps, and even plug in his phone to play along with songs he is learning. You can also program the set to customize the sounds that each of the drums make. Assembly took a while, but was straightforward. It doesn’t take up very much space, and my son plays it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: S. Behson PhD

customer_reviews.title: Worst building instructions ever
customer_reviews.text: The product is not bad for a beginner's drum set. We shall see how long it lasts as my daughter is playing every day so far. But the disaster is, putting the thing together. Can the manufacturer's not put a decent set of instructions together with these things? Pieces corresponding with step by step instructions. It's a 4 hour build with these terrible directions.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trinoskey

customer_reviews.title: Good sound,  defective frame, zero customer service
customer_reviews.text: The drums arrived last week with a bent frame on one side. The threading is off making the left drummer's side bent. I've emailed the seller and manufacturer hoping for a solution. Update: you can only email customer service. They have never called or emailed even though I went through the process several times. They did send me a customer satisfaction survey, which I used to reference the absolute zero response ice received. Crickets. I hope if you order this, it arrives prefect otherwise you are sol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drums with a volume knob!
customer_reviews.text: Compact (well, as compact as a full set of drums can be), sounds like drums, and great for beginners. My wife and I have been in bands with guitar and bass and wanted to give drums a try. We also always had problems at rehearsals because the drums are so loud. Everyone always turns their instruments up so they can hear themselves, and then puts earplugs in to keep from damaging their hearing. Lol. Electronic drums are amazing. They feel really close to acoustic drums, at least as a beginner, and they let you adjust the volume of the drummer so you can do practices without earplugs. It's a futuristic wonder world :-)
customer_reviews.author: Katie Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kit for the price.  The mesh heads are great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The sounds on the module are fine for practicing but if you buy the USB adapter (sold separately) and hook it to the computer you can use drum programs or a sampler built into your DAW and it's amazing. I use addictive drums 2 and it has great features for playing live and exporting each drum to a separate channel in Ableton. Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner to intermediate drummer
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap electronic drum kit for beginner to intermediate drummer. The drum kit arrived in a giant cardboard box that neatly compartmentalized all the kits. It was satisfying to remove all the pieces out of each box and assemble the kit. I just wished the instruction was little more clear, but it was a simple build nonetheless. The drum kit is okay for apartment use, but I would recommend purchasing a drum mat to reduce the noise of the kick.
customer_reviews.author: Sung wan Park

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Came in one box, easy to set up. Decent sound quality. These are not for pros. But the are excellent for the price. Great for anyone learning to play. Just be advised if you’re a bigger person (I’m 6’2”) that they are a little short. Only drawback playing them is that the heads are a little small compared to acoustic sets. But it is advantageous to learn on a smaller head which makes it easier to transition to larger ones in my opinion. My kids love this set and have been playing non stop!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, kit for beginners or digital smarties
customer_reviews.text: Beginners: yes get it. It's simple, and great for learning and practicing. The mesh is good enough. Pads are a bit small. Advanced musicians and early dummers: I am you. I write songs weekly and grew tired of the simple tones. If you can manage buying some software and making this kit a controller, now you've got potential and will be happy.... Mine had some issues of sensitivity and I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Hauger Music

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Bought for my son. He can add worship from his phone, connect it to his drum set and sounds great as he plays with the song
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces 48” x 28”
customer_reviews.text: I’m a novice drummer living in an apartment so I find this to be a good drum set. Good price, fairly easy set up & it gives me something to use for practice. I may not have it perfectly set up but you get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: MAR

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Most of the detailed reviews already cover what I would say, however, overall this is a fantastic product for the price. Easy to set up, configure and use. The hardward seems durable. The sounds are very good. I would recommend trying different earbuds or headphones to see how they affect the sound quality (it changes the quality a lot). I wish I could modify the built-in sound library, but the user-defined kits are enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.S.

customer_reviews.title: OK kit, absolutely no support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to use while away at college. ~3 months in the snare started not responding unless it was hit super hard. I called support and was left on hold for an hour and then abruptly dropped costing me $25 in long-distance charges. Support requests through their website got me a form letter saying the would contact me in 2-3 business days which they never did. From my experience, Alesis doesn't support their products or honor their warranties. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Learning to Drum again!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice setup, the heads are a little smaller then I’d like but they work nicely and the sound (I use headphones and an extended cable for easier playing). I love all the different modes and it’s a great setup to get back in the swing of things again. It also doesn’t take up much room which I really like and for the price, you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased thinking it would be fun to bang around a bit and learn something new. This is FUN! I am now completely immersed and learning so much. I did have to upgrade my headphones to get the volume I was looking for. I also hooked it up to my guitar amp. It's not crazy powerful but it did the trick. I can see this being a hit not only for me but also for friends and party guests... So much fun... Delivery was quick, clean and easy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Keith LaFaver

customer_reviews.title: Impressive & high quality, AMAZING customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely impressed with this purchase! The drums are beautiful, just like the pictures, and they are easily adjustable with high quality feel. One of the pedals came damaged, but I called Amazon customer service who sent me to the manufacturer, and their customer service rocks! I think his name was Calder, and he sent the part and an email which gives me a direct line back to him if anything else comes up. Will give five stars once the part is delivered! Update: It was delivered within a week!!(:
customer_reviews.author: Along The Lines

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this kit. I’ve had it for about 2 weeks now. Seriously for the price you can’t get anything better. I’ve played on high priced Roland kits that don’t stand a chance against this. I have another cymbal and tom on the way as well! If you’re looking for an awesome affordable kit, do yourself a favor and get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Benzorg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing was super easy to setup and my son plays it daily. He has headphones he can plug into the computer so that we don't have to hear all of his practice. He also has the option to plug the kit into an external amp, which he does a lot, so that he can hear his drumming without the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Carcamper

customer_reviews.title: Starters Kit
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing drums on and off for over 30 years. I decided to get back into it just for fun. This kit does the job. Sound and room space are excellent. If you are looking for a kit just to play and relax ... then look no further however if you want to use this kit to travel with and play in a band...then Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Andrizzle

customer_reviews.title: Kind of small
customer_reviews.text: I ended up sending back. I highly recommend taking a picture of how it’s packed when you first open the box in case of return. It’s a puzzle for sure.
customer_reviews.author: FJanski

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: If your tall you will have to raise the set. I used a hole saw and stacked 2x4s I had that we're scrap. The preset kits are nothing great so I checked YouTube and figured out how to get a better sounds was way worth it. Sounds great now. The installation wasn't hard but it took a little while. One thing I don't like it's the toms are really tall for such small pads. I had to relearn how to play because I hit them so often.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great learning module
customer_reviews.text: Having played an electronic set before, this wasn't new to me. Being self taught on acoustic sets, this is a boon for beginners, and actually, it works well in our church services, hooked up to a sound system. Very adaptable, with the controller providing variety and learning all in one place.
customer_reviews.author: FunnyLittleFingers

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners just a small problem
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this because I've always wanted a drum after a few times playing it and having a blast I went to go play it once more only to realize that I can barely hear anything. I have turned the volume to max my headphones to max unplugged everything and replugged it all and used different headphones but I can't seem to fix this problem. It's good but I basically just wasted $400 to play it a few times
customer_reviews.author: Alex Stowe

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it. You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together, you can beat it hard (wink wink). It’s blacker than the blackest black top to bottom. Drum sounds are great. It’s expandable (like your girlfriend). Plug in your tablet, phone, MP3 player and rock out with your favorite band (providing it’s not nickleback, which in that case just get some pots and pans and make senseless noise). Sounds great through decent to even poor quality headphones. I mean, it’s a great quality product you can volume control. That’s a lot.
customer_reviews.author: jamie stonerock

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ive only had this product for about a week now. I will come back with an update if anything goes afoul. So far I am pleased with this Kit. It was relatively easy to install. Great kit for just banging around at home. I wouldn't recommend this kit in any professional level though.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Doon dat doon doon dat boom boom boom tssss
customer_reviews.text: This is the best e-kit you can get for this price. It sounds great, it’s pretty quiet outside of the headphones, so you’re not driving everyone crazy. The only thing I don’t like about it is the different kit sounds it has are only numbered and they don’t have names.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been playing the drums for 15 years but have lived in an apartment for the past few years without my acoustic kit. I bought these hoping they’d be at least somewhat decent and they have more than exceeded my expectations. The kick pad can still make a decent amount of noise depending on how hard you play, but I only play during the day so my downstairs neighbors can (couldn’t think of a review appropriate term for what they can go do)
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Morris

customer_reviews.title: It's ok i guess. Definitely not a real drum kit.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it at first. I still like it but its so small that im going to give it to my grandkids and just buy a real drum kit. The drums are too small and the rims are way to high. The sounds are not as good as a real drum kit but they are good to start out with for kids.
customer_reviews.author: the truth

customer_reviews.title: Great work
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed my buddy's DM7X kit for a while to play guitar hero / rock band. Turns out they are ust great in general, I have almost no issues. I like to hook up the headphone jack to a set of speakers and play guitar hero minus the drum audio, and use the Alesis Drumkit playing it's own sounds!
customer_reviews.author: James Waugh

customer_reviews.title: Complex, but amazing
customer_reviews.text: For what you pay, this is amazing. I love my set. The controls are a bit complex but I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Arndt

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: As a parent I highly recommend this drum set. My teenage boys set it up no problem. They can play right outside my room and I hear nothing!! They hook up headphones to it. You can also hook up speakers. Awesome. Also as they get better you can add to it.
customer_reviews.author: Charity Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great for small places
customer_reviews.text: I got this kit to play in a literal closet. It fits and I am very impressed with the quality, sound, features, etc. It does the trick for me. Nothing negative to say...at least not for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product indeed. Kudos to Alesis:) / Works great with Logic
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you really can't ask for more. The only dislike was the tiny switch but, it could be just me or the lighting at home. Used a 5 pin midi cable and routed the kit to my Logic Pro. It works great with Designer Drums:) The delivery of the kit was quick and smooth! Good job USPS and Amazon. CS
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use kit.
customer_reviews.text: So I did a fair amount of research into what would work best for me as far as versatility, sound and overall management of the kit. Ive dabbled with acoustic kits in the past and as a certified beginner this kit took me 45 minutes from box to playing, however, I understand the general layout of a kit and therefore believe thats why so many people are having a hard time with setup, it does look ominous upon unboxing, but its an easy setup. Youtube the video of the setup if you have any issues, its in that video somwhere. Everything came included ready to play with the exception of my pictures Simmons 50.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Such a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set similar to this many years ago, and at that time it cost four times as much as this kit. This one with mesh heads is actually better than that one was. Such a great deal. Made my son's online jazz class doable. So happy.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: For beginners and players with limited space or noise conscious
customer_reviews.text: Set up was overall easy. Mesh gives good feedback almost exactly like a real kit. First e kit but will impressed Kick has great feed back High hat pedal could be better but still nice. Plenty of kit options in the module to please a beginner. Didn't come with throne. Biggest complaint is the overall size just feels cramped at times
customer_reviews.author: luciano reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great value, takes time to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Excellent sound quality and the mesh drum heads are so much for fun and realistic to play with than rubber. The reason for my four star rating is that the assembly instructions were difficult to follow. The whole kit is black so you can’t see which direction the screws and posts are oriented in the instruction photos. But after some trial and error I managed to figure it out. Also, be aware you’ll need to buy an amplifier and/or headphones if you want to hear yourself play.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Keith

customer_reviews.title: great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: we use these live in small bars and restaurants. The drummer is happy with the mesh heads and the bar owners are happy with the volume control. mixing is easy to because we have our settings saved and just run two cables to the mixer. its a small kit too so its easy to fit in the back of a small SUV. if i were to buy again id go for the next step up with bigger heads. other than that i have few complaints. great practice kit.
customer_reviews.author: Emma E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Drum Set
customer_reviews.text: how do you get a legit electronic drum set for less than $400? You buy this set! With the audio out to an amp, the module has plenty of different sounds. Sending midi into a daw via USB lets you make this set sounds like a $10k Pearl set!
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Great set. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a professional drummer and he just wanted to try something different. It’s compact but packs a lot of punch. We have a great time with this set. You can change the high hat to a double bass. Easily hooks up to amp or speaker for max wattage!!! 🤟🏽
customer_reviews.author: INDY MOM

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I just have always wanted to play drums along with my favorite music and this set up provides that capability perfectly. I can hook up my iPhone and play my favorite music, while also overlapping in real time with my drumming. It all comes together through my headphones so it doesn't disturb the rest of the household. Sometimes the sound can overload the system. When it does, I reset it and maybe lower the volume. But so far, everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I am a semi-pro drummer, now living in an apartment. I can't believe I never thought of owning an electronic kit before! Now I can work on my chops and keep the noise down. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mom approved and kid tested!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions aren’t super clear. There was a lot of looking at the picture and guessing. My 12 year old loves it though and it’s stood up to his insane solos. I encourage him to play and the fact the it’s electric helps me keep my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah F

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little set
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband, and he really loves it. It's easy to move and the sound quality is good. It has some fun features, like being able to play a song from your phone and play along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners but Questionable Module
customer_reviews.text: I really loved playing on this drum kit. The mesh heads are quiet enough to not disturb the neighbors and great when it comes to reliable feedback. The drumming module has a ton of different sounds and tones to play around with and you’ll definitely find your favorite set after going through it once or twice. I’m not sure if my module is defective but every once in a while it WILL turn off or refuse to turn on. It may be a unit error but don’t let it deter you from buying this kit if you’re a beginner. 3 stars for now.
customer_reviews.author: AnnJenel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great practice kit for the money. Best $350 I've spent in a while. So much fun and sooo much content on YouTube to get you started. I am just learning but 2 friends who actually play drums checked them out and thought they were a great value, even considering buying just to practice on because of the noise their acoustic ones make.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I Love these drums!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 55 years old and used to attempt to play acoustic drums in the 1980's, which I was getting really good I thought, even though the neighbors probably didn't think so! I sold them and have not had a set to play in many years now. I just bought these along with the alesis 2000 watt drum amp and let me tell you.... I was truly impressed with the sound quality and the volume and punch with the amp. I feel like I am 20 years old again, and it is so fun to turn up my iTunes on my stereo and play along with my favorites. Money well spent, no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Dwight D. Hollifield

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about drums, but my high school son has been pkaying percussion for years and is very happy with this kit. My only complaint is that there was 1 screw missing to hold up the stand.
customer_reviews.author: hockeymom

customer_reviews.title: Alesis
customer_reviews.text: I liked to buy a another one , because i am want to get a brand new one because i didn't the liked sellers bussines that ripped off to get a used one.. So find a better seller bussines that offer a new alesis drum set, nothing wrong drum the seller bussines didnt sent all equipment connected cable and got bad module.. i still have it.. i was disappointment why didnt sent me all cable 4 tom connection for drum kits and the module was mess up.. i wanted to blame the music store brought.. anyone i love it but i am get a new one
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good and affordable product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son who is 17 and he loves it. I think that it may not be a professional grade drum set, but is not a toy either. I don't know anything about drum sets but I honestly think this is a good beginner set that will be enjoyed for quite some time, it feels durable and of good quality even though is not the top of the line. Even I enjoy playing it. Lastly, I thought the price was very reasonable and I really appreciate the option to split it into four payments.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Flores Enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Great Digital Kit
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this kit! I purchased as a gift but I do have some experience on drums and found this setup quite friendly. I believe for beginners to intermediate this will be a great kit with room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Thumper

customer_reviews.title: Sound problem!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when it arrived. Overall maybe average but was very disappointed by the sound of the sticks hitting the pad because it was very loud quite comparable with the sounds from the drum pads themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Varinder

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! Was easy to set up, sounds awesome and feels as natural to me as a standard set. I've been playing for 28 years and needed something i could play at home on. I highly recommend this set!
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for the gigging drummer; great for beginners or, in my case, something to play once in a while; the stand itself is very flimsy; I do like the mesh heads (my wife actually likes not hearing the tap, tap, tap); decent value for the money;
customer_reviews.author: JohnC.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for practice set!
customer_reviews.text: For the price certainly wasn’t bad, especially that we were able to have a payment option plan. But the rim is a bit too hard and sounds too plasticky we are playing. However for a practice that I think is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D.

customer_reviews.title: No tuning needed!  Easy install. Good quality for price.
customer_reviews.text: Worth it. Multiple sound functions. Saves me from having to learn how to tune a drum. Easy install. Easy to connect with kids ipad for music on headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Nhu Anico

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 weeks use, already have problems
customer_reviews.text: Only after 2 weeks use, the base drum is falling apart and not able to stay at the same place, unable to step it properly
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: A great set of drums
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a couple months now and I love them. You can hook them up to a speaker or just use a set of headphones so you don’t disturb the household.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It is definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely worth the cost. A lot of variants sets come with it. You can listen to some amazing beats and slow it down. Each piece that hits lights up. On the brain so you can learn it.
customer_reviews.author: HIckmanwd

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I am only a novice player, trying to stretch out and hone my skills, and push it to the next level. This kit delivers! Set-up is a breeze, very customizable. I run my sound through a Crate 20 watt guitar amp. It just sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, fun to play, EXCELLENT customer service
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit. The only reason it’s not 4 stars is the durability. But get this, I broke the bass drum practicing. Sent an email to customer support and 5 min later had a response saying the replacement was in the mail. INCREDIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. This is a great beginner/practice kit. If you play hard or are more experienced drummer looking for a gig kit, I’d get the next level up.
customer_reviews.author: MFrancis2012

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My 12yo assembled this all on his own. He loves it. He plays it for hours till he’s sweaty and his arms are sore! And all we hear is a quiet tapping. :)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Henson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner drum set for our son. Took about an hour to put together, but wasn’t difficult. Love Amazon’s option to split payments up monthly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fullmer

customer_reviews.title: Light work
customer_reviews.text: If I could return it like an overdue copy of the matrix from blockbuster i would. I love it, it’s lots of fun, tried to stuff it entirely in my ass and it did t fit.
customer_reviews.author: 3TrVbQg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Lots of instruments available to program
customer_reviews.text: I love this set . I use it as a practice set at night with headphones. Tons of choices for instrumentals and fine tuning pitch, reverb and a bunch more
customer_reviews.author: John Oldfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I've ever made. I have been a drummer since I was 4, I'm 33 now always used to use acoustic sets and bash E drums but this is nice..takes a little bit of getting used to but the modules easy to use, the pre-made kits are awesome, and a self timing adjusting metronome let you know whether you're rushing or dragging why is my fan on it's not plugged up baby I highly recommend picking one up.
customer_reviews.author: Shifty423

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly I was quite impressed with the cymbal sounds. Mesh pads are nice and quiet and responsive, after receiving my son (drummer of over 20 years) went out and bought the same set. Great deal Very user friendly module.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who plays drum set in the jazz band at school. It gives him the ability to practice at home now.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk12

customer_reviews.title: Good set for the price. Very happy with Alesis
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy enjoy playing it. Easy to use features. When ordering it, I was sold a used for a few bucks off. Didnt know originally that was happening. Told had to cancel order and reorder. Sent from Amazon. It was in a tons of pieces. The set is a great buy, but not worth the few dollars off. Took an hour to back together.
customer_reviews.author: Swaff84

product_meta.title: Alesis Drums Nitro Mesh Kit | Eight Piece All Mesh Electronic Drum Kit With Super Solid Aluminum Rack, 385 Sounds, 60 Play Along Tracks, Connection Cables, Drum Sticks & Drum Key included
product_meta.description:
Style:Nitro Mesh Kit

Feel The Difference Mesh Can Make 
At Alesis Drums they know that feel and natural-response is a must have for an immersive, expressive drumming experience. Introducing the Alesis Nitro Mesh Kit, an addition to Alesis' all-mesh kit roster that delivers the most realistic playing experience modern drummers demand. The Nitro Mesh Kit is a complete eight-piece electronic drum set featuring Alesis' next-generation mesh head drum technology - The unanimous preference of electronic drummers for their natural feel and ultra-quiet response, ideal for late night practice sessions and privately honing your drum skills. Don’t settle for second best, discover the new standard in electronic drums with Alesis drums. 

Pro-Performance Mesh Heads 
The Convenience of electronic drums fused with the response of a traditional acoustic set. The Nitro Mesh Kit comes complete with an 8 Inch dual-zone mesh snare drum, (3) 8 Inch mesh toms, (3) 10 Inch cymbals, custom-designed Alesis hi-hat and kick pedals, and a durable four post aluminum rack. 

Everything You Need 
Right out-the-box, the Alesis Drums Nitro Mesh Kit doesn’t disappoint and guarantees to get you playing drums immediately. All the cabling, a power supply, and a drum key are included for easy, hassle-free setup; we even include a pair of drum sticks. 

Sound Matters 
It’s not just about the feel, Alesis drum’s Nitro Kit features a core sound-set ready for any genre you throw at it. With 385 drum and cymbal sounds, expertly curated into a collection of 40 ready-to play sets, we give you everything you need to supercharge your performance. 

Sharpen Your Skills 
Nail that all-important drum fill and lock down the groove with the Nitro Mesh Kit’s powerful practice-centric features. With 60 built-in play-along tracks, a sequencer, metronome and performance recorder, Nitro Mesh Kit is an ideal tool that gets the best out of your performance. 

Connectivity Covered 
Pump up the volume or practice in silence – whatever your preference, the Nitro Mesh Kit has you covered. With a 1/8 Inch headphone output, stereo ¼ Inch TRS outputs and a 1/8 Inch aux input, hassle-free rehearsals, practice and recording sessions couldn’t be simpler. 

Creative Control 
Take command of your studio, capture your creativity and discover a world of virtual instruments. With Nitro Mesh’s USB-MIDI and MIDI In/Out ports, transmit MIDI information directly to a computer and unite your synthesiser, drum machines and more for expanded performance potential.
feature_bullets: Next generation mesh Performance | all-mesh drum heads deliver the most realistic, responsive and immersive playing experience modern drummers demand
Premium eight-piece configuration | 8" Dual-zone snare pad, (3) 8" Tom pads and (3) 10” cymbals: Ride cymbal, hi-hat, Crash w/choke
In-demand sound | Nitro drum module with 40 ready-to-play classic AND modern kits, 60 play-along tracks and 350+ expertly curated sounds
Powerful educational features | 60 built-in play-along tracks, sequencer, metronome, aux input and performance recorder help to hone and develop your drum skills
Everything you need | 4-post aluminum rack, connection cables, drum sticks, drum key and power supply included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,844 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
